tag_list: games, gaming, mmorpg, entrepreneurship, colorado, lycos-the-dog
overview:
Horsfall is a consumer marketing expert who has been involved in several technology ventures and has had a hand in over $8 billion of liquidity events.

Horsfall held senior marketing roles at Valvoline and Lycos and CEO roles at White Summit Strategies and Gemini Voice Solutions (PhoneFree). Recently, he held the CMO role at Turbine Games (Lord of the Rings, Dungeons & Dragons) which was purchased by Warner Brothers Interactive Entertainment in 2010.

Horsfall is currently the Co-Chair of Startup Colorado (part of Startup America Partnership) and recently founded SpringsStartup as part of that effort.

Horsfall joined mobile platform developer Spectware, Inc. as their CEO on May 22, 2012. Spectware provides a leading, paperless, cloud-based mobile application platform for the management and inspection of heavy equipment worldwide.

Horsfall sits on the boards of Concealfab, Spectware, Tins.ly, SpringsStartup, Startup Colorado (Part of Startup America), Cravey, Devium, and Colorado State University College of Business.

milestones.description: Horsfall left Spectware by design on August 20, 2012 after reformatting the company from an LLC to a C Corp and prepping the company for their Series A.
milestones.source_description: No longer on Spectware's web site.
